intro: Chylismia brevipes subsp. arizonica, commonly known as the Arizona shortstem chylismia, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the Sonoran Desert. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered white to pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments with limited water availability. It is often found in areas with sparse vegetation, such as slopes and canyons. Due to its restricted distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
